reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent a week at Ink48 in October. Very clean and modern, although rooms are small. Service was as good as at a Ritz Carlton or Four Seasons property. "Print," the restaurant on property, offered excellent food but only so-so customer service when a meal was prepared differently than ordered. The server and the manager both had attitude. Note: the restaurant is not managed by the hotel. We will return to the hotel, but there are too many good restaurants nearby to waste time with servers and managers who are more intent on telling you what they think you did wrong than fixing the problem.
reviews.title: Outstanding service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You usually would have found us staying downtown in SoHo but with all the hurricane uncertainty we played it safe in midtown this weekend. And we have not been disappointed! Not expecting much space in a New York hotel room, we upgraded to the deluxe for a very reasonable premium and this hotel sure as hell delivers the square metres advertised. To top that we've a cool view of the river. The rooftop Press Lounge on the 17th floor provides a nice venue to grab a drink and look out over the city. It feels like there should be a pool on the roof, don't be fooled by the water feature! The Espresso martinis there didn't live up to my expectations - they need to get a coffee machine up there.
reviews.title: Huge deluxe room with huge bathroom, unheard of in NYC!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: Never thought I'd be staying out on 11th but it's been absolutely fine. Hells Kitchen is a couple of blocks away with some great restaurants to choose from, especially if you like Mexican. For me, the Hell's Kitchen restaurant wins hands down if you can get a table. It's a walk down to Chelsea if this isn't enough for you and a quick cab ride to MPD or to 5th Avenue to hot the shops.
reviews.title: average experience in NYC

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all, loved this option. With power out downtown most of the weekend, it was the right choice, especially for the amazing space we've got.
reviews.title: Very Nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: I stayed in the INK 48 Kipmton for 3 nights in October while on business travel. The selection was made by my employer's agency, but I was generally fine with the fact the location is not central. I enjoyed a long walk every morning. The rooms are very spacious, well equipped, and have all the necessary amenities. I did not have a great view though, my room was on the 3rd floor. But could not ask for a change at the check in...It was the shortest check in ever in my life. The receptionist talked to me less than 2 min, obviously tried to get rid of me as soon as possible, and gave only very limited information about the hotel/room and all available services etc. I was quite surprised about this attitude, I did not insist on continuing with my questions and went to the room.
reviews.title: Wonderful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: What can I say - I was arranging the trip of a lifetime for my wonderful sister (Mum of 3) her first visit and the concierge could not help enough!
reviews.title: Fabulous hotel, rooms with a view, excellent service - ok location...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: I called the standard booking line to check that I had a city view - all confirmed and then the concierge wrote to me checking if he could make it a special visit - was all ok with the room - GREAT service.
reviews.title: One of the BEST !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Arrival was pleasant and soon in my room I was advised to register to receive free water and internet - which I did. Next minute, Fizz and sweets arrived for my sister to welcome her to NYC for the first time and so it continued!
reviews.title: The good and bad

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From restaurant bookings to advice - all was catered for.
reviews.title: Nice hotel but far from mass transit
Beers do not cost $25 at the rooftop bar...
reviews.text: The only downside is if you are a walker (like I am!) then this can be a hairy traipse from central, past the Salvation Army hostel and their guests!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Got a King Premium City-View room for special rate. Spacious room/bath for NYC. Large windows with great city views. There is a restaurant and a roof top lounge. Close to Times Square and Intrepid. Friendly staff, met fun people from around the world during the complimentary/daily wine tasting. There was the 5th oldest Tavern across the street that served great food for cheap. Diners close by for breakfast.
reviews.title: Trendy & Clean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at Ink 48 from Monday 19th - Friday 23rd December - Christmas time was just magical in NY and would recommend anyone to visit at this time of year!
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel with great views and service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First of all, the location of Ink 48 is absolutely great if you don't mind walking (which we didn't). It only took about 15 minutes to get to Times Square (which the hotel is pretty much in line with, just a few avenues out!) and was also near to the Grayline sightseeing buses (also very good). We actually enjoyed our walks to and from the hotel and found some lovely little places to stop and eat/get breakfast/a coffee.
reviews.title: Yet another great Kimpton hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we arrived we were greeted by our lovely receptionist, Nandi, who informed us we had a free room upgrade to the 17th floor!! This room was stunningly, amazing and had spectacular views of midtown Manhattan! We couldn't believe our luck and to top it off, Nandi had a free bottle of fizz brought to our room!! Needless to say, we were blown away! :D
reviews.title: Xmas in Hell's Kitchen

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast was simple but delicious with fresh fruit, either toast or a pastry included and tea/coffee/fruit juice. All the staff were really polite and provided excellent service! The wine hour was good with unlimited refills (dangerous) and there was also hot, spiced wine whilst we were there - yum!
reviews.title: A GREAT HOTEL IN NEW YORK

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: this hotel has very kindly staff and very good skyline view but it's a little bit out of the center. it's next to hudson river and 10 mins to times squire by walking. it has an awesome roof bar with a great view. you'll love it.
reviews.title: excellent view but poor location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very nice hotel, great service, rooftop bar was an awesome spot to relax and enjoy the skyline. It was a pretty far walk to get to MOMA & Times Square, but plenty of restaurants/bars within a two block walk.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012
reviews.text: We stayed there last month and it was a bit of a disaster...rooms are very average. Our stunk of sewage we had problem with the toilet making noises at night ( ok it can happen) and despite we reported the problem to the staff, nothing was done a part from spraying air freshener in the room. As a result, the next night the toilet was flooded and we had to change room in the middle of the night!
reviews.title: Definitely not a 4 or 5 stars!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012
reviews.text: As you may have understood the staff is not very helpful and friendly ( only one guy called Andres was nice and gave us nice advises to where to eat etc).
reviews.title: New favorite hotel in NYC - both business and personal
Unique and good location
reviews.text: I reccomend not to have anything from the minibar as we payed a bottle of water 7.45$!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: For a weekend trip to New York I decided to stay somewhere other than the usual Times Square area and decided to try out Ink48 in Hell's Kitchen--a great decision. The hotel was beautiful with excellent service. What really made it the perfect choice though was the room. I chose a Hudson River Suite and could not have been more satisfied--definitely worth the price. It had three "rooms"--a large bedroon area with a very large and comfortable bed with good lighting and a large tv, a living room area with a very comfortable couch, a desk with chair, and a comfortable chair, and a large bathroom between the two (with a hallway separating the bedroom and living room areas--no separate door; an opaque door closing off the bathroom. The bathroom was very large with 2 sinks, a separate shower and very large tub and a little nook with the toilet. The shower was very large with a rainforest shower-head but the star of the bathrrom was one of the largest tubs I've ever seen. Usually, I limit myself to showers but the tub was pretty inviting and I tried it out--it was great; had to force myself to get out to get to a show. The highlight of the suite, though was the incredible view. There are floor to ceiling windows along the entire length of the suite (except for a closet that is opposite the bathroom) and there were incredible views of the river. The hotel looked down on the Manhattan cruise terminal and the USS Intrepid (aircraft carrier museum). Beautiful views of the river and the city beyond the river--it really made for spectacular scenery both during the day and at night. (One downside is that although there are very effective shades to block out the sun, there are gaps between the shades to early morning light does get in.)
reviews.title: Beautiful Views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location proved to be particularly convenient for going to the Jacbo Javits Convention Center, the Intrepid Museum, and the Manhattan cruise terminal (I would definitely stay here for a pre- or post-cruise stay) but it also turned out within easy walking distance of Times Square and the Theater District (which I found out when I had difficulty getting a cab after a Friday night show). About a 15-minute walk down streets that did not seem unsafe (always had some pedestrian or car traffic). The immediate area around the hotel did not have much in terms of restaurants, but there were quite a few a block or so toward mid-town.
reviews.title: A really good hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One thing to watch out for is that the late-night (all day) menu is very limited and dinner service ends at 10:30 pm, so don't the mistake I did of waiting until after a show for a late night dinner (but I found a cheese plate and salad worked out okay). An earlier room service dinner I had the following night was fine--quick service and good food. Breakfast in the restaurant was also good. They have an afternoon wine reception (5:00 pm-6:00 pm), which I missed both days I stayed in the hotel, but it seems a nice amenity. I also missed on my chance to visit the bar that is supposed to have great views (it was closed one night for a private event, which is probably not that rare), but with the great views from my room I enjoyed a nice glass of wine from my room and enjoyed the views anyway.
reviews.title: Another great boutique hotel in Manhattan!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: The suite has two closets--a relatively small one across from the bathroom and another one in the entry hall (which I used to staff my coats). There are also very comfortable bathrobes for use (in fact I had already bought one from a prior stay at a Kimpton hotel in Baltimore--another hotel I enjoyed).
reviews.title: Another Great Kimpton
Good visit, spoiled by payment problems.
reviews.text: I drove to NYC and the hotel was pretty close to Lincoln Tunnel; parking is expensive ($55 a night--valet) but I found that it worked out well to just park the car and take cabs and walk to get around town.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I am a fan of Kimpton hotels, and I'd say ink148 is the best I've stayed in yet.
reviews.title: Swanky, sophisticated spot to stay in NYC

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: The rooftop bar provides exquisite views of the city side and river side - not to mention great people watching. Yes, the drinks and food are overpriced, but what do you expect? It's a prime location in NYC!
reviews.title: Don't Bother

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised by the caliber of the Zagat-rated restaurant - Print. The food was divine - aside from the popcorn flavored ice-cream that my husband ordered for dessert. It's an interesting menu option, but I still shiver thinking about how wrong it felt to ingest cold, popcorn-flavored ice-cream. YUCK. We missed the hotel's happy hour both days, but I applaud anyone who hands out free booze.
reviews.title: A fresh hotel with a fantastic rooftop bar

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The gym was great. One of the best I've seen in a hotel. Many machines available, along with headsets and TVs. They also piped in music in case you forgot your iPod.
reviews.title: 3rd hotel in 3 days!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Lastly, the hotel is a little off the beaten path, but you have fast walkable access to an array of restaurants in hells kitchen, and you are a short hike to Times Square. The rest is just a quick cab ride away.
reviews.title: Loved it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff were great and we got told we had been upgraded which was great. The room was large and the bed huge, clean and great view as has huge glass windows. But you pay the price for the area. We were at the end of a 3 weeks stay in NY and Boston so felt confident but even we felt the area on a night was not the best. If your only staying a few days its a 15 min walk to times square in a straight line but same for tube. The hotel is nice but be aware if you go to the roof top bar its costs $25 for a beer (Norm $5.50) and bodka and coke (norm $6). Get the feeling this wopuld work if in a better location but then prices would be higher so catch 22. It depends what you are looking for, we also stayed at the hotel mulberry same great rooms 5 min walk to tube and 5 mins from little italy and just great location.
reviews.title: Average, not the best area and drinks on the roof are a fortune!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all, my husband and I had a great stay at Ink48.
reviews.title: Nice digs, inconsistent customer service...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was on the 8th floor, and we booked a CityView Suite through Sniqueaway.com. We had a not so great view of a Verizon parking lot, but if we just looked past that we had an awesome view of the Hudson, and the Intrepid Aircraft carrier, which was really awesome!
reviews.title: Would stay here again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our arrival was a little awkward, when we pulled up there were signs everywhere that said no double parking at anytime, but no door man was there, and no one ever came out after a few minutes. When I hopped out of the car and went into the lobby, 2 people were at the front desk and the doorman was just hanging out. They sort of looked at me like I was a nuisance, it was weird. Eventually the door man came out and gave us a ticket for our car. The man at the front desk was not very friendly, but not entirely unpleasant. He let us know our room was not ready, and took our phone number to call us when it was. I had a feeling we wouldn't receive a call due to how carelessly he wrote our number. Sure enough, after 3 hours and no call, we went back and he was long gone, and a much friendlier girl let us know our room was ready.
reviews.title: smart choice for a city hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011
reviews.text: The room was super clean, the bed was cozy, and the bathroom was stunning. A HUGE tub, and awesome 4 sprayer shower.
reviews.title: Amazing hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ink48 was exactly as we expected - we booked a Hudson suite for 5 nights over Christmas on the kimpton website which offered a good deal and we were on the 8th floor - great views! All staff were friendly and helpful. Wine each evening between 5-6pm - nice gesture. We ate in the bar the first evening - nice salads and just what we needed after a long flight. Had room service one morning which was expensive for what we had but efficient. The location was good - couple of blocks from times square and taxis were always available. All in all a good experience and I would recommend it to friends :)
reviews.title: Great - did what it said on the packet!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Our family choose Ink48 as a place to gather at Christmas - we came from Washington, DC, NJ and Massachusetts and had a fabulous time. The hotel was extremely helpful in planning our visit. The staff is very responsive and in a city not always described as friendly and helpful, Ink48 staff stood out as unusual. The restaurant, Print, is also terrific. We had a dinner for 8 on Christmas Eve and they thoughtfully provided us with a round table in a corner so we could all talk to each other. It was perfect! And best of all, the lounge on the 16th floor is truly spectacular. This is a hotel that cares about its guests and best of all, it is convenient to everything in midtown Manhattan.
reviews.title: A wonderful Christmas in NYC - thanks to Ink48!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Convenient location not too far from Midtown (10 mn on foot from Times Square) in a quiet place close to hell's kitchen.
reviews.title: Nice place to stay except the roof top

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011
reviews.text: Very professional and smily staff at Reception/Concierge desk and Bar & Restaurant at Ground floor.
reviews.title: Great!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: The only thing is about the pathetic level of service at Roof Top : either you'll be rudely chucked out from the place by a big dog because it's a private party or served by an haughty waitress if they let you in.
reviews.title: Great treatment!
